member_organisations:
A complete and up to date list of members and contact information is published on our website at the address below: 
http://britishchamber.be/directory
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security
head_office_address: Avebury House Second Floor, 55 Newhall Street,
eu_initiatives:
We have five subject groups (task forces) within our EU Committee which organise events around the issues our members have an interest in. These are: 
Financial Markets 
Environment & chemicals 
Single Market 
Food, Health & Consumers 
Competition & Trade
organisation_name: British Chamber of Commerce | EU & Belgium
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
We are a member of COBCOE, an independent non-profit organisation representing 35 British chambers of commerce across Europe. Acting as an umbrella organisation, COBCOE works with member chambers to advance international trade and business with the United Kingdom. As such, it gives a voice to about 6,000 businesses, mainly located outside of the UK, from all sectors of trade and industry involved in business with the UK. 
 
Its aim is to protect and promote international trade. To do this, COBCOE liaises closely with the UK government and other organisations.
relevant_communication:
The events we arrange range from small scale briefings with ten people, focused on specific and often technical dossiers, to large scale conferences or dinners with senior speakers from government and business covering strategic considerations.Our communication activities are centred around our events - mainly through online media and mailing to our members. 
 
We do not generally produce policy positions or publications or undertake lobbying activity and undertake no other projects in this field (we do projects around trade and business development between UK and the EU) 
 
Information on our events, both forthcoming and past, is available on our website.
